Adding GPS Navigation - Using GPS, the bowling ball can provide directions to the nearest bowling alley or the shortest route based on traffic conditions.
Smart Lanes - By using sensors embedded in the lanes, the bowling ball can provide real-time information about the lane conditions, including ball speed, rotation, and linearity.
Voice Interaction - By using voice recognition, the bowling ball can provide interactive coaching and feedback to help players improve their technique and performance.
Augmented Reality - Augmented reality can be incorporated into the bowling ball to provide a more immersive experience by overlaying digital content onto the physical environment.

Virtual Training - With virtual reality technology, the bowling ball can be used to provide realistic simulations of bowling scenarios in training mode, enabling players to practice and refine their techniques.
